markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tri-Bladed Katar](/Weapons.aspx?ID=246)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Disarm" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=175" />
<trait label="Fatal d8" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=178" />
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Tian Xia Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=230) pg. 127, [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 106

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Characters from Tian Xia have access to this option_

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 8 sp

**Damage** 1d4 P

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Simple

**Group** [Knife](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=9)
</row>

</column>

---

This punching dagger resembles the standard katar, save that a pair of blades can be folded out from the center blade, transforming the weapon into a starburst shape well suited to catching foes' weapons.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-9" />
name: Tri-Bladed Katar
